newsitem.title: USA: Iomega recalls some Jaz disks.
newsitem.headline: Iomega recalls some Jaz disks.

text.p: Iomega Corp said Friday it is recalling some of Jaz disks that were recently made for use in its Jaz drive.
The company said about 20,000 Jaz disks in the U.S. and about 55,000 Jaz disks outside the U.S. are affected and that the problem does not involve consumer purchases before March 24.
"It's a small portion of our overall production," said Iomega spokesman Cory Maloy.
Jaz disks are removable, one gigabyte disks that act as a hard drive and provide computers with additional storage. Maloy said the disks sell for as low as $89 each in packs of three.

The company said the affected disks contain a component that does not conform over time to its reliability requirements and said the disks could cause performance and data degradation and should not be used.

"Iomega is taking immediate steps with its distributors and channel partners worldwide to remove affected disks from the marketplace and quickly replenish their inventories," the company said in a statement.
